abstract: You can save electricity by setting your computer’s monitor to turn off automatically after a few minutes of inactivity.
snippet: You can save electricity by setting your computer’s monitor to turn off automatically after a few minutes of inactivity.
lead_paragraph: If you’re not eating lunch at your desk or working all night, you can save electricity  and maybe even a little bit of the earth  by setting your computer’s monitor to turn off automatically after a few minutes of inactivity. This advice may seem rather basic, but about half of Americans don’t do this, according to a Harris poll last year.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Saving a Little Bit of the Earth

abstract: Microsoft Corporation is underwriting an online movie-making contest to stimulate sales and burnish the reputation of its Windows Vista operating system.
snippet: Microsoft Corporation is underwriting an online movie-making contest to stimulate sales and burnish the reputation of its Windows Vista operating system.
lead_paragraph: CALLING all would-be Judd Apatows, Martin Scorseses and Coen brothers. Your cinematic ambitions may be supported by an unlikely patron, based not in Hollywood but more than a thousand miles to the north in Redmond, Wash.

headline.main: Your Chance to Finish a Movie Microsoft Started
headline.print_headline: Your Chance to Finish a Movie Microsoft Started

abstract: I’d like to convert text in an e-mail message from capital letters to standard uppercase and lowercase letters. Is there a way to do this, or am I stuck retyping?
snippet: I’d like to convert text in an e-mail message from capital letters to standard uppercase and lowercase letters. Is there a way to do this, or am I stuck retyping?
lead_paragraph: Q. I have text in an e-mail message that was typed in capital letters, and I’d like to convert it to standard uppercase and lowercase letters. Is there a way to do this, or am I stuck retyping?

abstract: In the wake of its failed $47.5 billion takeover bid for Yahoo, Microsoft apparently sent a calling card to Facebook, the social networking site, to see if it might be up for a deal.
lead_paragraph: In the wake of its failed $47.5 billion takeover bid for Yahoo, Microsoft apparently sent a calling card to Facebook, the social networking site, to see if it might be up for a deal.

headline.main: Looking for a Deal, Microsoft Said to Feel Out Facebook

abstract: How to get Microsoft Office Ultimate costing $680 for $60. And you don’t really have to be a student.
snippet: How to get Microsoft Office Ultimate costing $680 for $60. And you don’t really have to be a student.
lead_paragraph: J.D. Biersdorfer, who dispenses advice to Times readers on everything electronic, passed on this tip for anyone who is thinking about buying Office Ultimate, the tricked-out version that costs $680.

headline.main: How to Get Microsoft Office at 91 Percent Off

abstract: Google executives answer (some) questions about the Yahoo-Microsoft meltdown at a meeting with reporters.
snippet: Google executives answer (some) questions about the Yahoo-Microsoft meltdown at a meeting with reporters.
lead_paragraph: Will you do a search advertising deal with Yahoo? How will you do it in a way that avoids antitrust objections? Are you relieved that Microsoft withdrew its offer for Yahoo?

headline.main: Google: We Like Yahoo, and We Like It Independent
